questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are a student of 'X' College. Write an application to the Principal of your college for introducing multimedia facilities in classrooms.

sub_questions.explanation:
[Your Name]
[Your Address]
[City, State, Zip Code]
[Your Email Address]
[Your Phone Number]
[Date]
The Principal, [X College], [College Address]
Subject: Proposal for Introducing Multimedia Facilities in Classrooms
Respected Sir/Madam,
I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. As a student of [Your Course/Department] at X College, I am writing to bring to your attention a proposal that I believe will significantly enhance the learning experience for all students: the introduction of multimedia facilities in classrooms.
In today's digital age, traditional teaching methods are being complemented, and in many cases replaced, by interactive and multimedia-based learning techniques. The integration of multimedia resources such as projectors, smart boards, and audiovisual equipment can greatly enrich the educational experience by making lessons more engaging, interactive, and accessible to diverse learning styles.
Multimedia facilities in classrooms would enable instructors to incorporate a variety of teaching aids such as educational videos, interactive presentations, and digital simulations into their lectures. This would not only capture the attention of students but also facilitate better understanding and retention of complex concepts.
Moreover, multimedia facilities can accommodate different learning preferences and cater to the needs of students with varying abilities, ensuring a more inclusive learning environment. Additionally, the use of multimedia technology fosters creativity and critical thinking skills among students by encouraging them to explore, analyze, and synthesize information in innovative ways.
I believe that the introduction of multimedia facilities in classrooms aligns with X College's commitment to providing quality education and preparing students for success in a rapidly evolving world. Therefore, I urge you to consider this proposal favorably and take the necessary steps to implement multimedia facilities in our college classrooms.
Thank you for considering my suggestion. I am confident that this initiative will greatly benefit the academic community at X College and contribute to the overall enhancement of our educational experience.
Yours sincerely,
[Your Name] [Your Course/Department] [Your Roll/ID Number]

questions.uddipok:
Suppose, you are a reporter of 'The Daily Star'. Now, write a report for your newspaper on ' Food Adulteration'
which has become a burning issue.

sub_questions.explanation:
Food Adulteration

It is matter of great concern of all that unsafe food serves as a growth medium for bacteria that can cause food poisoning.Foodborne diseases may turn fatal and even cause death. There is lead in turmeric, formalin in fish, fruits, vegetables and milk. High concentration of pesticides and chemical preservatives are found in fresh produces. Studies show that farmers use a concoction of toxic chemicals to fight pests and they indiscriminately use chemicals in crops to extend shelf life without showing any concern for the health of consumers. We also know of contamination by microorganisms leading to acute food poisoning. Food safety is a scientific discipline involving safe production, handling, preparation and storage of food in ways that prevent contamination and growth of bacteria. It is done to prevent foodborne diseases. Therefore, it is the responsibility of those who handle and prepare food commercially and at the same time of consumers to ensure the food is safe for consumption.Contaminated foods can carry harmful contaminants,chemicals, parasites and toxins. Application of excessive and unauthorised additives and colours for making food items tasty and attractive can be lethal as many such chemicals may cause cancer and other life threatening ailments. Millions of people of our country become ill from foodborne pathogens each year.On the basis of a surveydone from 2010 to 2013,the Public Health Institute stated that 50%of all food items were found to be adulterated.Greed for fast profit among food traders has led to today's alarming situation. Poisonous residues in food items leave the worst impact on children's mental and physical growth and women's reproductive system including fertility. They cause cancer and damage vital human organs like liver,kidney and heart. Frequent reuse of oil in cooking food items release carcinogenic materials which may lead to cancer.Now a days, formalin is one of the burning topics of discussion.Though many food items contain naturally occurring  formaldehyde but that level is permissible for human consumption. When formaldehyde is found in excess amount it becomes a source of health concern. Formalin applied on fish,fruit,meat and milk causes cancer,childhood asthma,skin disease etc.So the government monitoring agencies must ensure judicious use of formalin in food items.The relevant government agencies for food safety have a role to play in consumer protection. They need to educate producers on how to produce safe food, and at the same time punish people who deliberately sell unsafe food. The Bangladesh Food Safety Authority was incorporated in 2013 as an Act to help coordinate food control and consumer protection activities across the country. FAO is providing technical assistance to the Ministry of Food in this regard. But there is also the need for political will to devote sufficient public resources to make the system operational and effective in the longer term.

questions.uddipok: Write a short composition on " Impact of Climate Change in Bangladesh ".

sub_questions.explanation:
Impact of Climate Change in Bangladesh
Long-term variation in temperatures and weather patterns is known as climate change. The frequent
shift of climate in Bangladesh has been showing a number of devastating effects, such as, rising sea level, floods and intensifying cyclones, Firstly, Rising sea level is a growing threat to people all around Bangladesh. To illustrate, Two-thirds of the land of this country is less than fifteen feet above sea level. So, the increase of sea level might cause extinction of huge low land area, Respondingly, The dwellers of the area may have to migrate from their own land. Secondly, Climate change is making rainfall more erratic and often far more intense. In terms of Bangladesh, this reality has recently become quite evident, Because of irregular rain and melting the Himalayan glaciers, Bangladesh is now far more vulnerable to devastating floods, Lastly and more importantly, The Bay of Bangal narrows towards its northern shore where it meets the south of coast Bangladesh. This narrowing can both direct cyclones towards Bangladesh's coast and make them more intense. To conclude, to minimize climate change, some immediate steps could be taken such as planting more trees, reducing the use of CFC gases, using electric vehicles, recycling plastic materials, In a word, People should practice eco-friendly behaviors to protect the nature as well as themselves.

questions.uddipok: Internet is influencing our young generation both positively and negatively. Write a composition on the 'Uses and Abuses of Internet'. Write at least 200 words but don't exceed 250 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
The number of internet users around the world is increasing drastically with every passing day and so is the number of internet addicts. The world of internet is extremely alluring. Video games, chat rooms, social media platforms, entertainment videos, engrossing web series and interesting blogs can keep a person hooked for hours. Many people begin to use internet as a means to overcome loneliness and boredom and get addicted to it within no time.

Introduction of Smart Phones Responsible for Growing Internet Addiction
Around a decade back when internet could only be accessed on desktop and laptop, the internet usage was limited. Many people were still addicted to it. They spent several hours in front of their systems surfing internet. Many people frequently visited cyber cafes to access internet. However, the situation wasn’t as bad as it is today.
The introduction of smart phones has given internet access to large number of people. Smart phones are said to be one of the major causes of internet addiction in today’s times. People are seen glued to internet even as they travel or attend a social event. Some of them are obsessed with chatting apps, others are addicted to gaming while yet others are busy updating and checking their social media accounts.
The introduction of various kinds of web series has increased internet addiction. It is an easy source of entertainment and extremely addictive. Binge watching web series is quite common among people around the world. Internet addicts forget to eat, complete important tasks, and ignore their loved ones. All they want is a high speed internet connection and a device to access it. This is straining their personal relationships and hampering their work.
Conclusion
Internet addiction is a serious disorder that blurs a person’s ability to think rationally. Even though internet addicts know the harmful consequences of this addiction and begin to feel the heat they do not make much effort to overcome it. This often leads to serious problems such as depression, anxiety and other mental health disorders.

Change the narrative style by using indirect speeches.
"Where do you like to go, sir?" asked the ticket seller. "Sylhet," replied the stranger. The ticket seller said, "Have you brought your NID card? The passenger replied, "Yes, please take it". "How many tickets do you need?" "I will buy ffive tickets." "Take these tickets. They will cost three thousand taka," said the ticket seller.

questions.uddipok:
Read the following passage and then write the antonyms or synonyms of the words as directed below :
After the flight of Yuri Gagarin, the first human being to travel to outer space in 1961, the Soviet Union decided to send a woman in space. Proletarian Valentina Tereshkova was selected for this project from among more than four hundred applicants. Since the successful launch of the spacecraft Vostok-5 on 14 June 1963, Tereshkova began preparing for her own flight. On 16 June 1963, she was dressed in space-suits and taken to the space shuttle launch pad by a bus. After completing her communication and life support checks, she was sealed inside Vostok-6. Finishing a two-hour countdown, Vostok-6 launched faultlessly . Although Tereshkova experienced nausea and physical discomfort for much of the flight, she orbited the earth 48 times and spent almost three days in space. She also maintained a flight log and took photographs of the horizon, which were later used to identify aerosol layers within the atmosphere.

(a) outer (antonym); (b) proletarian (synonym); (c) launch (synonym); (d) prepare (synonym); (e) began (antonym); (f) faultless (antonym); (g) nausea (synonym); (h) discomfort (antonym); (i) maintain (synonym); (j) later (antonym).

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) inner; (b) common/working -class; (c) takeoff/start; (d) arrange/plan; (e) ended/completed; (f) faulty; (g) sickness;
(h) comfort; (i) keep/follow; (j) earlier.
